files.description: Details of files to be uploaded or downloaded from Artifactory.

ant.description: If true, the command will interpret the patterns which describes the local file-system paths, as ANT patterns.

aql.description: An AQL query that specified artifacts in Artifactory.

archive.description: Set to "zip" to pack and deploy the files to Artifactory inside a ZIP archive. Currently, the only packaging format supported is zip.

archiveEntries.description: If specified, only archive artifacts containing entries matching this pattern are matched. You can use wildcards to specify multiple artifacts.

build.description: If specified, only artifacts of the specified build are matched. The property format is build-name/build-number. If you do not specify the build number, the artifacts are filtered by the latest build number.

bundle.description: If specified, only artifacts of the specified bundle are matched. The value format is bundle-name/bundle-version.

excludeArtifacts.description: If specified, build artifacts are not matched.

excludeProps.description: List of "key=value" pairs separated by a semi-colon. Only artifacts without all of the specified properties names and values will be affected.

exclusions.description: An array (enclosed with square brackets) of patterns to be excluded from uploading/downloading.

explode.description: If true, archive file is extracted after the operation. The archived file itself is deleted. The supported archive types are: zip, tar; tar.gz; and tgz.

bypass-archive-inspection.description: If true, bypass the security inspection the archive go through before it is unarchived.

flat.description: If true, artifacts are uploaded/downloaded to the exact target path specified and their hierarchy in the source file system is ignored.

includeDeps.description: If specified, also dependencies of the specified build are matched.

includeDirs.description: If true, the source path applies to bottom-chain directories and not only to files. Bottom-chain directories are either empty or do not include other directories that match the source path.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to fetch. Usually used with the sortBy option.

offset.description: The offset from which to fetch items (i.e. how many items should be skipped). Usually used with the 'sort-by' option.

pattern.description: Specifies a local file system path or a path in Artifactory.

props.description: List of "key=value" pairs separated by a semi-colon. Only artifacts with all of the specified properties names and values will be affected.

recursive.description: If true, files are also collected from sub-folders of the source directory.

regexp.description: If true, the command will interpret the patterns which describes the local file-system paths, as regular expressions.

sortBy.description: A list of fields to sort by. The fields must be part of the 'items' AQL domain.

sortOrder.description: The order by which fields in the sortBy option should be sorted.

symlinks.description: If true, the command will preserve the soft links structure in Artifactory. The symlink file representation will contain the symbolic link and checksum properties.

target.description: Specifies a local file system path or a path in Artifactory.

targetProps.description: List of "key=value" pairs separated by a semi-colon. The specified properties will be attached to the affected artifacts.

validateSymlinks.description: If true, the command will validate that symlinks are pointing to existing and unchanged files, by comparing their sha1. Applicable to files and not directories.

include-dirs.description: Set to true if you'd like to also apply the source path pattern for directories and not just for files.

from-rt.description: If true, search the files in Artifactory, rather than on the local file system. The --regexp option is not supported when --from-rt is set to true.

gpg-key.description: Path to the public GPG key file located on the file system, used to validate downloaded release bundles.
